answers.author: Amanda Dodge
answers.text:
Hi Randall, 
I have been able to find a few resources that you might find useful. I have found two documents from cemeteries in the UK that tend to focus their efforts on signage and trying to attract what they believe community members want. Generally, it seems as though they market their cemeteries more as parks to attract visitors.
Margravine Cemetery (pages 51-52):
http://bit.ly/h932ke
Wood Green Cemetery (pages 36-40):
http://bit.ly/gtvtA6
Also, the Illinois Municipal League published an article titled “Competitive Community Marketing: Fluff is Not Enough,” that describes fundamental marketing strategies. Although the document is not specifically targeted towards cemeteries, it should give you a good idea about possible ways to structure your marketing strategy.
http://bit.ly/gFEOxP
I hope this helps!
Amanda Dodge
International City/County Management Association
Knowledge Network Intern
202-962-3699
adodge@icma.org

author: Randall Dixon
text:
Our city has recently taken over repsonsibility for a local cemetery previously managed by the International Order of Odd Fellows (I.O.O.F.).  Having never marketed a cemetery before, I am hoping some of you have some suggestions about how to develop a marketing strategy for the cemetery.  Any advice is welcome.
- Scott Dixon, Town of Westlake, TX  817-320-1712.
title: Municipally owned cemetery marketing strategies?
